section.title: What is a program?

See Program Admin to learn more about setting up and administering your program of work.

section.title: Who do programs support?
section.p: Mingle programs primarily support people responsible for managing high-level objectives and work across multiple teams and projects that share a common goal. However, it’s much more about your specific needs and activities than your individual role.

section.title: What do programs support?
section.p: Mingle programs help you discover and communicate shared goals, coordinate those goals across multiple teams, and adapt them as they progress. As you manage your program of work, Mingle Plus presents realistic information that supports visibility and collaboration. It allows you to focus on delivering customer value and supports your teams’ unique and evolving processes.

section.title: What can programs help you achieve?
section.p: By focusing on high-level objectives and simple visual models, Mingle Programs can help you overcome the problems that often hinder successful cross-team coordination and collaboration. Managing your program with Mingle Plus, you can:

bullets.item: The big picture and the relationships among its component parts
The progress of the program as a whole

item.strong: Discover and create a shared understanding about customer value
Access specific data to help teams deliver

bullets.item: Communicate the purpose and value of program objectives
Identify the problem areas or understand where assistance is needed
Understand the status or accurately track a program
Understand diverse data within the larger program context
